intro: Sebaea lineariformis, commonly known as the linear-leaved sebaea, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Sebaea lineariformis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and adaptability to partial shade.
